ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes; excellent course, and excellent professor (see above).

A class that looks at writing as an ethical decision, and how different authors form opinions on it. I would recommend it, since it is a unique perspective on the literature and forces you to investigate different aspects of the novel.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Since I am interested in contemporary literature, this class certainly helped me because ethics is all the time more important in contemporary debates. The simposium is an excellent professional exercise, and the only time we have this opportunity in our department. The class also teaches us how to relate literature to other cultural and historical debates (not just art as autonomous all the time).
